item.title: Cyber Command Employment Personnel Training Act of 2016

A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to require the Secretary of Defense to provide training to employment personnel of the Department of Defense on matters relating to authorities for recruitment and retention of employees at the United States Cyber Command, and for other purposes.
Cyber Command Employment Personnel Training Act of 2016

bill.title: Cyber Command Employment Personnel Training Act of 2016

item.latestTitle: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.name: Introduced in Senate
item.text:
Cyber Command Employment Personnel Training Act of 2016

This bill directs the Department of Defense (DOD) to provide training to DOD employment personnel on matters relating to recruitment and retention of employees at the United States Cyber Command who: (1) carry out human resources management functions or who write hiring and pay guidance, or (2) are employed in supervisory positions or have responsibilities relating to the hiring of individuals for such positions.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
